alert.note: Alert for Salt Lake Valley (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 28 at 1:04PM MST until November 29 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches across western Salt Lake County, 4 to 8 inches across eastern Salt Lake County, locally higher. * WHERE...Salt Lake Valley. * WHEN...Until 2 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions are expected. The hazardous conditions will impact the Monday evening and Tuesday morning commute across portions of Salt Lake County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A band of moderate to heavy snow is expected to cross Salt Lake County later this afternoon into this evening and will impact the Monday evening commute. This band will last 1 to 2 hours, with additional light snow through the remainder of the evening. A lake effect snow band is expected to develop after midnight and continue through 9 AM to as late as 11 AM Tuesday morning. Periods of moderate to heavy snow will bring additional snow accumulations to locations impacted by this band, currently most likely to impact portions of southern and eastern Salt Lake County.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx or dial 511.
